image.altText: A man wearing glasses, with a grey beard, sits by a window with a curtain, his face partially in shadow.

props.synopsis: More than 3 million Australians have chronic pain. This treatment is popular, but it's putting lives at risk.

title.children: 'I miss my mate': David's wife of 43 years died after a popular procedure to treat pain

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: A 21-year-old man will appear in the Ballarat Magistrates' Court on Tuesday, charged with the murder of Clunes woman Hannah McGuire.

title.children: Man, 21, charged with murder after 23yo woman's body found near Ballarat

image.altText: Man in military uniform.

props.synopsis: A criminal investigation could be launched into the drone strikes that killed Australian aid worker Zomi Frankcom, says an IDF spokesperson who calls the incident "clearly a mistake".

title.children: 'Must be Hamas': IDF spokesperson launches defence of drone strikes that killed Australian aid worker

image.altText: Foreign minister Penny Wong faces the media in Adelaide 2024-04-06 100400__c03a7caeb3c81889ce55bcb98d97cb664019b1f5

props.synopsis: The federal government has appointed former ADF chief Mark Binskin to monitor Israel's response to its air strikes which killed Australian Zomi Frankcom. What will he do?

title.children: What will Australia's special adviser on Israel's air strikes achieve?

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: Groups spring up on social media, claiming to hold secret knowledge the Australian government is holding back from regular citizens: the Australian Taxation Office "isn't real".

title.children: Some Australians aren't paying tax due to a rise in 'sovereign accounting'

image.altText: A photograph of a total solar eclipse - the moon is skirted by a ring of bright light, that of the Sun

props.synopsis: The Sun is about to pull a disappearing act across North America, turning day into night during a total solar eclipse. Here's how Aussies can join in on the action from home.

title.children: Canada's Niagara region has declared a state of emergency ahead of the total solar eclipse. Here's why

image.altText: Silhouette of a crowd in front of a stage with warm white lights at night and a red triple j flag

props.synopsis: After a five-year break, Triple J is excited to announce that One Night Stand is returning this year.

title.children: One Night Stand is back for 2024: Want to host the party?

image.altText: Warren Entsch with a flower painted on his face with two people in marvel t-shirt

props.synopsis: Images of a federal MP in fancy dress appear to have contradicted claims he was unaware his wife was being paid to run face-painting and dress-up classes by a business that had government contracts.

title.children: Images of federal MP appear to contradict claims he was unaware his wife was paid to run dress-up and face-painting classes

image.altText: Signage for Federation University, Mt Helen Campus standing in green grass

props.synopsis: The National Tertiary Education Union says axing 200 jobs will be the death knell of Federation University, which has campuses across regional Victoria and in Brisbane.

title.children: Union calls for university leaders to resign over large-scale redundancy plans

image.altText: Pope Francis speaks into a microphone while reading from a sheet of paper

props.synopsis: The Vatican declares sex reassignment operations and surrogacy as grave threats to human "dignity", putting them on par with abortion and euthanasia as practices that violate God's plan for human life.

title.children: Vatican condemns sex reassignment surgery, surrogacy and gender theory as threats to human 'dignity'

image.altText: Jim Chalmers at a press conference with his mouth closed.

props.synopsis: The federal government says it supports fines of up to 10 per cent of Coles' and Woolworths' annual revenue if they are found to be mistreating suppliers, as it begins to move on the supermarket giants.

title.children: Government backs multi-million-dollar penalty regime for Coles and Woolworths over anti-competitive behaviour

image.altText: A man looks over the water, with an Australian Border Force badge on his arm

props.synopsis: A series of recent boat arrivals in WA's north has led a local shire president to believe the region's coastline is being specifically targeted, arriving in small communities near air bases.

title.children: 'Pretty good navigators': Shire president says boat arrivals 'well informed' and targeting WA's north

image.altText: Firefighters in bright orange uniforms gathering outside a brick building.

props.synopsis: Fighting fires is no holiday, but some CFA volunteers use their annual leave to respond to emergencies — or take leave without pay.

title.children: CFA volunteers want paid community service leave so they are not out of pocket

image.altText: A man in a blue suit, white shirt and blue and white stripped tie looks at the camera and pumps his fist

props.synopsis: In the video, Donald Trump says he supports exceptions for rape, incest and to protect the life of the mother, but did not say if he would seek a national ban.

title.children: Donald Trump says states should handle abortion law but does not address nation ban in new video

image.altText: A photo of two men standing in a room with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: NSW Police says the two men will be "dealt with locally" in the African country after the 16-year-old took his own life having engaged online with a person he thought was a "young woman".

title.children: Australian teenager who took his own life was allegedly extorted by two Nigerian men pretending to be a 'young woman'

image.altText: Brian Molko and Stefan Olsdal of Placebo behind textured glass. Molko has eyes closed, Oldsal wears a v-neck singlet

props.synopsis: Less than two weeks before the first concert, Pandemonium Rocks has ditched six acts from the music festival's line-up and made two venue changes. Fans are unhappy, but event boss Andrew McManus says there is no other choice.

title.children: Rock legends booted from this month's Pandemonium Rocks festival

image.altText: A large ring of white gasses can be seen in the sky.

props.synopsis: Mount Etna has released volcanic vortex rings, a rare phenomenon caused by a constant release of vapours and gases.

title.children: Vortex rings rise from Italy's Mount Etna volcano

image.altText: Jeremy Finlayson's head in his hands

props.synopsis: AFL boss Andrew Dillon has refused to compare Jeremy Finlayson's homophobic insult to other slurs that have taken players in league circles in years gone by.

title.children: 'There'll be an accountability': AFL ponders ban for Finlayson's homophobic slur

image.altText: Part of a road destroyed

props.synopsis: Storms have washed away the only access road to the Megalong Valley in the Blue Mountains, leaving 200 people cut off and business facing huge losses.

title.children: Helicopter drops food, supplies to NSW community isolated by landslide

image.altText: Two women, one holding a young child.

props.synopsis: For the first time, Kumanjayi Petrick's family speak about their loss, one month since the stolen car crash that took his life and sparked violent unrest in Alice Springs.

title.children: Alice Springs family speaks out about town's violence after fatal crash of teenage relative

image.altText: Qantas plane on the runway at Brisbane airport

props.synopsis: The Australian share market posts gains on Monday after US stocks surged on a strong jobs report that also indicates wage growth remains in check. Look back on the day's events and insights from our business reporters as it happened with our blog.

title.children: Qantas overhauls loyalty scheme to offer more seats at a higher cost as ASX posts gains — as it happened

image.altText: A close-up shot of Daniel Martin Torrijos getting into a car, wearing sunglasses and a white shirt.

props.synopsis: The youth custodial officer who found Cleveland Dodd unresponsive in his cell has told a coronial inquest into the teenager's death that the tragedy could have been avoided. WARNING: This story contains the name and image of an Indigenous person who has died.

title.children: Youth custodial officer tells inquest Cleveland Dodd's death was preventable

image.altText: A man is led away from a home by police.

props.synopsis: New details emerge about a fictitious criminal syndicate police say they set up to solve the 24-year-old mystery of Canberra grandmother Irma Palasics's murder, as a second man is committed for trial in the ACT Supreme Court over her killing.

title.children: Police pretended to be criminals to coax confession from man accused of killing Irma Palasics, court documents reveal

image.altText: Two soccer players wearing yellow and green jump in the air during a game

props.synopsis: The Matildas have been torn apart by injury ahead of their Mexico friendly. It begs the question: How will they survive the Olympics?

title.children: Matildas' growing injury list exposes shallow pool of players to draw from

image.altText: Industrial factory with sunset in background

props.synopsis: Green hydrogen has been dubbed the energy of the future. Now, Australia's largest hydrogen electrolyser facility will be able to turn water into green energy without using fossil fuels.

title.children: Australia's first commercial-scale green hydrogen electrolyser facility is open for business

image.altText: Compile photo of a hand holding a mobile phone with a phone tower image on it

props.synopsis: The 3G network is closing and there are concerns Australians with older 4G phones may also be caught out because of the way the phones are configured.

title.children: More than a million older mobile phones at risk of being blocked from making triple-0 calls

image.altText: A rugby league player with ball in hand, running at a pair of defenders who brace for the tackle

props.synopsis: The NRL has decided not to honour Michael Jennings's 300-game milestone with traditional celebrations due to the Sydney Roosters centre's past off-field incidents.

title.children: NRL will not celebrate Michael Jennings's 300th game

image.altText: Man in white cap.

props.synopsis: New South Wales man Michael Thomas Rae has pleaded guilty to unlawfully killing Wesley Prentice in a daylight shooting in the Newcastle suburb of Cooks Hill.

title.children: Michael Thomas Rae admits to unlawfully killing man in daylight shooting

image.altText: Football fans walk to game at Mount Barker Oval.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's premier wine regions will host a Gather Round game next year, with the AFL estimating more than a quarter of a million attendees across matches at the weekend.

title.children: More than 250,000 attend Gather Round games, SA Premier announces wine region location for 2025

image.altText: Photo of a man bringing a dark brown horse around

props.synopsis: The first living foal of one Australian racing's all-time greats, sired by champion stallion Pierro, went under the hammer at the Inglis Easter yearling sale in Sydney.

title.children: Filly by champion mare Winx breaks world record with $10 million auction sale

image.altText: Two police officers talk to three kids in the Alice Springs CBD.

props.synopsis: The youth curfew in Alice Springs banning children under 18 from the town centre at night could be extended beyond Wednesday following a meeting of government agencies on Monday afternoon, the Northern Territory police commissioner says.

title.children: Alice Springs youth curfew extension to be discussed in emergency management meeting today

image.altText: A metal cover hanging from a plane wing with sky in the background.

props.synopsis: US Federal Aviation Administration said it would investigate the incident on the Southwest Airlines flight that was forced to return to Denver International Airport.

title.children: Boeing 737 forced to turn around after engine cover falls off and strikes wing on take-off

image.altText: A woman stands at a high-rise office window, her back to the camera. The window is covered with x-rays.

props.synopsis: A major investigation into the chronic pain industry has uncovered how Australia's healthcare system is being left open to financial exploitation by some medical practitioners.

title.children: Questionable billing by some doctors is rife in Australia's medical industry. Here's how it works
